> I have a problem with java.beans.XMLEncoder that only occurs 
> when my t=
est is run in the swing GUI JUnit and not when I run 
> through ant.
> 
> M=
y XMLEncoder test runs fine when I run it via ant. But when 
> I run it usi=
ng the swing gui (running from within idea) it 
> comes up with the stack o=
verflow error below. Normally my 
> tests run fine in both ways.

Hello Mor=
ten,

I'm afraid I'm not too familiar with this problem, however, I do have=

the feeling that I have read about this before.  I searched the archives
o=
f this list, and Google, but to no avail (granted I haven't tried too
hard)=
.

Here is what is tickling my brain:
  I have the feeling that this is a c=
lassloader issue, as is typical
with the JUnit Swing GUI.  You didn't menti=
on: whether it worked using
the AWT and Text Runners; nor which version of =
JUnit you are using.

However, in line with what I say above, there are two=
 potential
problems/solutions:
- the first is more of a solution than a pro=
blem, and has to do with the
excluded.properties file.  Check that an entry=
 for the XmlEncoder
package is in/out, and try adding/removing the entry.  =
It may create
more problems than it solves, but its worth a try.

- the sec=
ond is more a problem than a solution: check that you do not
include 2 vers=
ions of the XML libraries in the classpath.  This
sometimes causes the Swin=
g GUI to get its knickers in a twist.

Try these out, and report back if su=
ccessful.

Manuel Amago.
